update.description:
I found the DRCVehiclePlugin API a bit ambiguous with regard to steering. For example, the method SetSteeringState is not obviously about the steered wheels. I've attempted to make the methods self-describing by referring to the steering wheel as "handwheel" and references to the tire steering as "steered wheels".

I've also added parameters for the radius of each wheel, the front and rear track widths and the wheelbase. These parameters are derived from the collision objects associated with joint names passed from the sdf to the plugin code (front_left_joint, front_right_joint, back_left_joint, back_right_joint). I assume that the the wheel link is the child of the joint. I also assume that each wheel has only one collision object attached. These assumptions work for the low_poly_golf_cart model, but are sensitive to the formulation of the sdf.

Using the wheelbase and track width parameters, I added Ackermann steering to the model, though I still need to explain the equations I used.

I also adjusted the pose math used to computed the vehicle geometry parameters.

Then I merged with gerkey_default to get the fixed header files.
update.title: Several changes to DRCVehicle plugin

update.title: Several changes to DRCVehicle plugin

content.raw: I agree that they could be private. I'm open to suggestions as to what is the cleanest way to do this.
content.html: I agree that they could be private. I'm open to suggestions as to what is the cleanest way to do this.

content.raw:
maybe we should make get_collision_radius and get_collision_position private?  do we expect anyone else to use these functions except internally to the vehicle plugin?

and given they are now member functions, it's probably not necessary to make them static, thought I don't think that would hurt.
content.html:
maybe we should make get_collision_radius and get_collision_position private? do we expect anyone else to use these functions except internally to the vehicle plugin?

and given they are now member functions, it's probably not necessary to make them static, thought I don't think that would hurt.

content.raw: Merge when ready; I released drcsim 1.1.0 and branched drcsim_1.1.
content.html: Merge when ready; I released drcsim 1.1.0 and branched drcsim_1.1.

content.raw: I updated the documentation to be doxygen compatible and I moved the get_collision_radius and get_collision_position functions to be static within the DRCVehiclePlugin.
content.html: I updated the documentation to be doxygen compatible and I moved the get_collision_radius and get_collision_position functions to be static within the DRCVehiclePlugin.

content.raw: I could make these function calls static, if that would be cleaner (per Brian's comment).
content.html: I could make these function calls static, if that would be cleaner (per Brian's comment).

content.raw: Hold off on merging this until I get 1.1.0 released.
content.html: Hold off on merging this until I get 1.1.0 released.

update.title: Several changes to DRCVehicle plugin

content.raw: I'm not sure what the consequences of that are. I just made these functions because I repeat these operations several times. I don't need them to be called externally. Should I make them part of the plugin class?
content.html: I'm not sure what the consequences of that are. I just made these functions because I repeat these operations several times. I don't need them to be called externally. Should I make them part of the plugin class?

content.raw: Missing doxygen for most of the functions. Every function needs all the parameters and return values documented.
content.html: Missing doxygen for most of the functions. Every function needs all the parameters and return values documented.

content.raw: Is there a reason to have these function external to the plugin class?
content.html: Is there a reason to have these function external to the plugin class?
